Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: thornwald
Reviews.Content: I spent one day and a half in the Hotel Residence at january 2012. It is a 3 stars hotel with a good service from the reception and close to a huge amount of shops and restaurants. As it was new years eve there was a lot of noise in the street but someone can go to the airport and come back for 10 turkish liras by the Havas buses, whose stop is in taksim square in front of turkish airlines. I could also use the internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money but ...”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good location near Istiklal close to Taksim square, really good value for money. Cons: Noise from outside and from the corridor (earplugs was really helpfull), WiFI is slow, It was not allowed to invite my local friend to the room, what was very strange (the receptionist was very impolite talking about it).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Amity S
Reviews.Content: For the price, Hotel Residence deserves 5 solid stars. Room was very modern (yet small), all facilities were spotless, and there was even free wifi. Breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious and full of options. We stayed here nearly 2 weeks and didn't tire of it ( I noticed some other reviewers said it got old, but I don't know how it could have - meat, loads of cheeses, jams, breads, honey, yogurt, dried fruit, etc). Everything was great. Front desk staff was excellent and was always willing to help. They are also present 24 hrs, so no need to feel unsafe. Its a bit odd that whenever you leave the hotel you have to leave your room key with the front desk, but I suppose that serves some other purpose that I am unaware of. Never the less, someone is always present and willing to help. There is also a computer available for use in the lobby as well as an elevator to assist with the bags. Room service is available as well, which you pay for upon check out (pretty standard). Location in bustling Beyoglu couldnt be better - trust me, forget the old city, stay in Beyoglu. Its fantastic and theres always something to do. Unlike other travelers we never had a problem with noise; double-paned glass took care of any street noise (which is definitely there due to the busy area). Overall, I couldnt recommend this hotel more. Great value for the money. We were truly impressed. Oh, and one last thing; when you get a cab from the airport, they may be hesitant to take you down the main street of Beyoglu (given that it is *mostly* pedestrian). The cab driver might drop you off a few blocks away, which of course, is reallly confusing when you don't know where you are. We got lost and had to haul our bags around cobblestone streets for about 20 mins. This absolutely sucks when you're sleep deprived and cranky. Best advice: have the address handy and know it well, or just insist the cab take you to the hotel to avoid getting lost. No fun.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accomodation in the center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: evemauve
Reviews.Content: For my second time in Istanbul , I chose to stay around the Taxim area in order to explore the modern part of the city. Hotel Residence was a perfect choice!! Just off Istiklal avenue, a few blocks away from Taxim square. The hotel's rooms are nicely furbished ,rather small , but since I was a solo traveler I was given a double room and everything was fine! Breakfast was more than adequate , exactly what I wanted to start the day! The best thing about the location was that the hotel is in the middle of Istanbul's nightlife and there are hundreds of choices for dinner or drinks The only negative thing was that the people at the reception had a little knowledge of English. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who does not seek for luxury but a cheap solution (39 euros/day) in the center of the city

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Simone1806
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting any kind of luxury from the Hotel Residence, then this place is not for you. My overall impression of the place was that it was in need of a bit of a refurb. For example, in the bathroom the sink needed resealing and some of the wiring was visible, the aircon worked well - but looked really old. However, for 40euros per night for bed and breakfast in the heart of a big city I am not going to complain. The staff were friendly and always said "hello" - they spoke English well, the room was clean (if a bit drab), I was in room 506 on the 5th floor. The breakfast was basic - but the bread was nice and fresh and there were several different kinds of cheese which were good to try. There was also cornflakes and some kind of choco flakes if you wanted cereal, and plenty of jams/marmalades etc I It is in a noisy location and at night I could hear the muffled sounds of the local nightlife (room 506 was facing the street that the hotel is on), this was not an issue for me as I was out all day and came back quite late (walking around that area at night is so interesting - so man side streets to explore and it is so busy!).. so I was tired and went to sleep without a problem. In the morning it was distinctly quiet! I stayed for 2 nights and it was just right for me. The positives of this place definitely outweigh the negatives. It is close to transport, close to the main street and shopping areas, lots of places to explore... good for a place to sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Very central for nightlife, not good for sleep”
Reviews.Author: sheddie70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here fro 2 nights in March. Hotel is located near to Taksim Square and just off Istanbuls main shopping street. Area is very lively at night with lots of bars, restaurants,clubs and cafes. Masses of people. Hotel is clean, if a little tired looking, but comfortable. Although in a very busy area the room was insulated from the noise outside, but not from the waterworks of the rooms next door, whioch were loud and woke me up on both mornings of my stay. Breakfast variety was good, but quality not so, much better to take it in a cafe outside. Had free wireless internet access

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location - best area to be in Istanbul for leisure and very small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MarcioHaddad
Reviews.Content: Not close to the turist sites but these ones can be easily reached thru public transportation during day-light. At night it is located where you should be to save taxi fares. Free WiFi Internet in all floors. Bad point - I have never seen such a small bathroom. After you take a shower you will need to dry the whole bathroom ... it needs urgent restauration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaNar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel with my wife for 4 days. First of all - great location, right in the center of Istiklal Street, where you can find anything you need. Secondly - very good hotel personnel, ready to assist you on any matter. Thirdly - safe place to stay, right across the hotel there is a police station. Minuses are - horrible internet speed in rooms, small rooms and noisy street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price and location”
Reviews.Author: renedu
Reviews.Content: Great location - good price 50 Euros for a double..have stayed in the new trendy istnabul boutique places that just dont cut it with the bad service and amateurish appraoch to hospitality business. Love the street, it is like old istiklal and not the globalized mall that it is becoming... Free fast internet and breakfast is good, except coffee of course.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Cypriot71
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul on return from Prag/Wien trip with family. The reason for our visit was shopping. We stayed there for 3 nights and were very happy staying there. The hotel is only 3 buildings away from the popular Istiklal Street, so the location is more than perfect. The rooms are being cleaned daily and the sheets and towels are changed. The room and the bed is very clean which is not normal at a 3 star hotel in Istanbul. The bathroom is very small as stated in other reviews but that was not a problem as I only spent 5 minutes showering every day. The staff was kind and helpful. They asked me if my kids could sleep well. The breakfast was good as well. There were everything we looked for. As a result, I would not hesitate staying at this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: Ankka
Reviews.Content: We made an online reservation. The location seemed to be perfect for our trip. Finding the hotel was quite difficult as it is situated on a labyrinth of narrow and crowded streets. The staff was friendly welcoming us but the shock was when we finally entered the room. It was supposed to be a double room (twin beds) but what we found was scaring. Very small room, with a very small window (no view unless some pipes and other buildings walls very close to the window). The bathroom was also very very small, no window of course. Instead of a small closet and a small TV there was no space for anything else. The smell was also there... We left the hotel in 5 minutes even though we had to pay for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: xalara
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The location is really fine. The buffet breakfast is all that you could expect and well presented. The staff were very friendly. The hotel is centrally located on a side street and easy to find. On that street there are several small places to eat which are somewhat cheaper and you can buy your newspaper and small items from the shop next door.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: anthios
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in perfect position, clean, secure and low cost if you book it from internet.

Reviews.Title: “Could be lots better, could have been lots worse”
Reviews.Author: dreamkeepers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights, at the 6th floor. For the 45 EUR per single room you'll get the standard double room (they don't seem to have single rooms per se). Means one room with a TV, A/C and a queen bed plus another room, with two single beds. Both rooms are divided by a lockable door. The other room also has A/C, TV, two chairs, sofa and glass table. Both rooms have windows, and share a terrace. The bathroom is small, the bathtub is tiny - it's not really a bathtub, more like a deep shower taking tub. It was clean, but the toilet was leaking from the bottom, so the bathroom floor was wet all the time. I accidentally locked the door to the second room, and when going out asked at the desk for it to be fixed - it wasn't when I came back. I guess because I was out and they couldn't have tip for the job, but maybe front desk just overlooked my request. Staff speaks moderate English, but is polite. I went for a music festival, which means I just slept and showered there, I didn't get to see other amenities. All in all, if that's your limit, it's as good as it gets for the price. It's on killer location, has enough people at all times to be safe to walk around even in small hours, but cozy enough not to be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A standard 3 * hotel in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few steps away from the busy Istiklal Cad., the heart of Taksim. The Galata Tower is about 10-15 minutes walk. The rooms and bathrooms are tiny but clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast which is tasty, is served in the -1 floor. Free wifi is provided but the signal level is very low in rooms. The price is very reasonable (40 Euros) considering its location and service. Lots of restaurants nearby.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residence Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: 19 Sadri AlIsIk Sokak, 34430, Istanbul, Turkey
